lender.name: Patty
lender.loan_because: Perhaps it's Catholic guilt, even though I'm not Catholic; or perhaps it's Buddhist guilt, which is more likely.
lender.occupational_info:
COMPASSION IN ACTION!!!
"Do not impose on others what you yourself do not desire." ~ Confucius
The painting you are viewing is that of the Medicine Buddha. The painting was done by a Tibetan refugee.
****************************************
Please check out The Tibet Fund to help the good people of Tibet:
www.tibetfund.org
****************************************
Please check out GlobalGiving to donate to grassroots projects from around the world:
www.globalgiving.org
****************************************
And please help support pediatric HIV/AIDS treatment In China:
http://www.globalgiving.org/projects/pats/
In the early 1990s, hundreds of thousands of peasants in central China contracted HIV when they sold blood to alleviate their poverty, leaving behind a generation of HIV-positive children whose caretakers are unprepared for managing their treatment.
Pediatric AIDS Treatment Support trains and employs local community health workers who educate caretakers and provide HIV-positive children with comprehensive medical support, access to life-saving drugs, and a monthly food package.
****************************************

lender.name: Jamie
lender.loan_because: The creatures that inhabit this earth-be they human beings or animals-are here to contribute, each in its own particular way, to the beauty and prosperity of the world. -Dali Lama

lender.name: Larry
lender.loan_because: Well, actually I don't "loan" any longer. We are not loaning to persons or groups. These loans are approved and disbursed long before they are posted on Kiva. What we are really doing is relieving the local financial institution of any possible loss should their borrower fail to repay. That is not the same as loaning to a budding entrepreneur as commonly suggested by Kiva. We have become a "free" source of money to a wide variety of financial institutions, institutions that really do not need assistance. Institutions that do not discount their rates to their clients even though the money doesn't cost them anything. Servicing a loan where you have related money costs and charging 40% interest can (almost) be justified. When your money costs are zero, 40% can not be justified, that is pure profit to the institution at the expense of the client we are supposedly assisting. I choose not to participate any longer in this deception after making 179 loans here. Sorry Kiva, nice idea but lacking in truth.
lender.occupational_info: I'm a retired computer programmer.

lender.name: Wayne
lender.loan_because: i believe everybody deserves a leg up. i would not have received my education without student loans

lender.occupational_info: I am a consultant specializing in human resources and marketing.

lender.name: Leslie
lender.loan_because: we are all in this together
lender.occupational_info: I work as a gardener. I have worked work on an organic farm and in community gardens in the city. I strongly believe in organic agricultural methods and so I tend not to loan to projects where the money is used to buy chemical fertilizers and pesticides. Agricultural chemicals do a lot of damage to the soil and can be quite dangerous for the people using them. There are many organic methods to improve the quality of the soil. I think that development and sustainability must include health, ecological and environmental concerns. I want to support traditional methods that may have been lost in the process of colonization and I don't want to support the chemical and financial traps that many small farmers can fall into; needing money to buy more chemical fertilizer because it actually depletes the soil's natural nutrients. These aren't always easy decisions to make. I have decided to support sustainable practices, agriculturally and in other endeavours. My first loan was to an electronics store in Nicaragua but I realized that isn't how I want to participate, I don't need to create more electronic refuse for the vast landfills in Central America (or anywhere else for that matter). I lived in Central America, I have seen the landfills. So here's to sustainable best practices and local traditional knowledge. I am also interested in supporting artistic endeavors. One loan I made was to support a Mayan women in Mexico who does traditional embroidery. In general the indigenous peoples are not well treated. Having travelled in Mexico and Central America, I admire the peoples, their hard work and their desire to be respected for who they are, their history and their future.

lender.name: Jonathan
lender.loan_because: I want to help in a more direct way. Kiva seems like such a wonderful way to practice a few random acts of kindness.
lender.occupational_info: I interpret and apply laws to resolve criminal and civil legal disputes.

lender.name: The Lapeyres
lender.loan_because:
Our house burned to the ground in the SD wildfires in 2003; and we lost all our material possessions and many precious pictures and home videos. We were showered with help and support from family, friends, strangers and nonprofits everywhere. Participating in Kiva is one small way to "pay it forward" across the world.
The efficient, direct, personal one-to-one connection to the entrepreneur is the magic of Kiva!
lender.occupational_info: My wife and I work daily on staying connected with our two sons and keeping our family as close as possible. We work to instill in them the values that have guided us in life.

lender.name: J-9
lender.loan_because: I want to help others improve their lives.
lender.occupational_info: I teach seven year-old children in a public French school.

lender.name: Gina
lender.loan_because: When someone believes in you, you can accomplish anything.

lender.name: Emily
lender.loan_because: It's a small way to help others who have less money. I loan because I would hope someone would do the same for me if I were in need. I loan because helping is something I love to do.

lender.name: Linda
lender.loan_because: I appreciate the opportunity to be involved.
lender.occupational_info: business teacher

lender.name: Jantzen
lender.loan_because: i love to help people
lender.occupational_info: I am 17 years old and a Senior in high school.

lender.name: Dee
lender.loan_because: I know the little I can give will go a long way to help those who have so much less. I believe it can make a difference & that is always a good thing.
lender.occupational_info: I did work with people, helping them move forward in life after a family member had died. I think I received more than what I gave.

lender.name: Jordan
lender.loan_because: It's the least I can do to help someone in need. When I lend I feel like I can make a difference.
lender.occupational_info: I go to school five days a week. I am in seven classes during the day, and do singing and acting after school.

lender.name: Rachel
lender.occupational_info: I provide bookkeeping and small business consulting.

lender.name: Emily
lender.loan_because:
I can and I know how hard it is to fundraise. This is a brilliant concept and I'm glad to be a part of it.
(PS, I'm the one on the left in the green dress!)
lender.occupational_info:
I work at Living History Farms, an outdoor museum in Iowa that tells the story of agriculture and how Iowan's transformed the midwest!
There are three working farms the represent 1700, 1850, and 1900 and an 1875 frontier town.
Bo & Luke, the Oxen in the picture, work the land at our 1850 farm.

lender.name: Sean
lender.loan_because:
I want to help people build their business, help their family and communities.
I believe everyone deserves a shot at having their dreams become reality and if we can help we all should.

lender.name: Louis
lender.loan_because: I believe in what Kiva stands for all of us helping eachother.
lender.occupational_info: We here have various projects but our main big project is a waste management project using a technology that takes waste all types of waste without the need of preseparation and transforms such waste to use able materials such as materials for civil construction like bricks and concrete. Our intention is to use our revenues to support economic and social development in various cities in the country of Brasil.

lender.name: Bethany
lender.loan_because: people need it.

lender.name: Alazar
lender.occupational_info: Not many people want to be doing business with a collection agency...it's a pretty thankless job...if you require lots of pats on the back this line of work is probably not for you.

lender.name: Tom
lender.loan_because: It makes me feel good to be able to help.
lender.occupational_info: I assist clients with their business and estate planning and with their real estate matters.

lender.name: Maria
lender.loan_because: I can

lender.name: Erin
lender.loan_because: I want to help people who are working hard to make their and everyones lives better.

lender.name: Julie
lender.occupation: Janitor, project director, taxi driver, cynic.
lender.loan_because: I want to help in a way that empowers people, especially women - they make the world go around.
lender.occupational_info: Decrepit, loads of kids, live in a shoe, you know the drill.

lender.name: Debra
lender.loan_because: I want to honor the memory of my son, Alex, who passed away last year. Alex's dream was to own his own business and to change the world. Through Kiva, I can see his dreams realized.
lender.occupational_info: I train teachers who work with mothers and their small children.

lender.name: Mara
lender.loan_because: I am very grateful for help I have received in my life and I honour the opportunity to reciprocate.

lender.name: Santa Barbara Bookies
lender.loan_because: We love to help women start and maintain businesses so that they can be as independent and prosperous as possible.
lender.occupational_info: We are a group of 10 women who have been reading together since 1992. We meet monthly over dinner and a shared love of reading. We are: Realtor, Hair products sales, retired attorney, retired teacher, 5th grade teacher, botanic specialist, practicing attorney, office manager, CPA, Arts and Lectures staffer at UCSB.

lender.name: Barb
lender.loan_because: The small gesture that I can extend will make a enormous difference in the life of someone else.
lender.occupational_info: Using a computer, I make maps.

lender.name: Andy, Yvonne & Ariel
lender.loan_because: to empower grassroot businesses that might be more sustainable and tied to local needs and conditions
lender.occupational_info: I (Andy) work to support wildlife refuges, supplying water resource expertise.

lender.name: Eitan
lender.loan_because: I would like to assist people in kick starting a business, so they can maintain themselves instead of depending on charity.

lender.name: nicole
lender.loan_because: It is a good way to help those who are less fortunate than myself.
lender.occupational_info: I am a secondary school teacher in Canada.

lender.name: Celestia
lender.loan_because: It's a fantastic idea. We all tell our kids how great we have it here in the US, and how others in developing countries have so many challenges. But this is a way for us--ALL of us--to help. There aren't many people who can give up their daily lives and join the peace corp, but every single person in America can easily loan $25. I'm certainly not in a high-income bracket, and I was able to.
lender.occupational_info: I draw cartoons and other illustrations for commercial use and for gifts and souvenirs.

lender.name: Eric
lender.loan_because: It is a fantastic way to make a difference in the world.

lender.name: Wendy
lender.occupational_info: I study how humans alter soil fertility and plant growth

lender.name: Dude
lender.loan_because: I can, therefore, I should.

lender.name: Mazi
lender.loan_because: It's a great way to leverage my resources to help people get ahead.
lender.occupational_info: Bringing people a smile by connecting them with loved ones.

lender.name: Joel
lender.loan_because: I was inspired by this organization's mandate to empower hard-working individuals with loans, rather than simply handing out cash. I like Kiva's use of the internet to foster a somewhat personal relationship with the entrepreneurs. I feel like an investment partner and have a real desire to see these businesses succeed.

lender.name: Lisa
lender.loan_because: it could help people in need

lender.name: Olivia
lender.loan_because: I want to help people who need money all around the world.

lender.name: Remi
lender.loan_because: I want to make a difference!

lender.name: Charlie
lender.loan_because: The greatest gift is giving!
lender.occupational_info: I own a commercial construction company and own and manage office properties.

lender.name: Trevor & Jenna
lender.loan_because: we want to and we need to...
lender.occupational_info: We both work in the non-profit health / Community Work field in Nashville.

lender.name: Patty
lender.loan_because: Everyone deserves a chance at a better life.
lender.occupational_info: Use science to help doctors cure people who are ill.

lender.name: Lily & Ciaran Barry
lender.loan_because: My husband and I feel it's a great honor to be able to assist someone that is doing something really special in their life. Being able to give to someone that is creating a future for them and their children is priceless. We are blessed to be able to give. Thank you Kiva!. Jah Bless
lender.occupational_info: I help people with there paper work when they are buying land or a building. My husband works in Construction.

lender.name: Jessica
lender.loan_because: My aunt gave me this as a Christmas present and I am interested to see what it is all about! What a great gift, because I get to share it with someone else!
lender.occupational_info: I work with people to get them stronger after they have a injury or surgery.

lender.name: Teri
lender.loan_because: I believe in the power of one to make a difference to the whole.
lender.occupational_info: I work for a local non-profit group, Bridgeway House. An organization that provides services for children who have autism.

lender.name: Bill
lender.loan_because: I think Kiva has the right formula and the money is not wasted with overly expensive administration.
lender.occupational_info: Private Investigator enforcing Intellectual Property rights of companies and persons whose patents, trademarks or copyrights are being illegally used by other persons or companies that do not own them. Typically counterfeit watches and other products.

lender.name: Kirbi
lender.loan_because: the Bible says that's what Jesus would do.

lender.name: Melissa
lender.loan_because: I'm thankful for my life circumstance and if I can help someone else that enhances my life.
lender.occupational_info: I photograph weddings in California, USA.

lender.name: Erin Dibos
lender.loan_because: i have a little bit more than i need.

lender.name: Debra
lender.loan_because: I feel it is an excellent way to share a little of what I have.I feel that loans are better than donations from the receiving end as well - sense of accomplishment, pride, success, etc
lender.occupational_info: I work in the healthcare field. My job is to help restore function to those patients who have had a physical injury, disease process, or trauma. I work with patients with back, neck, or joint pain; those who have had strokes or spinal cord injuries; those with arthritis, joint replacements, and such.

lender.name: Sarah
lender.loan_because: in a small way I can help change the world.

lender.name: Eleanor
lender.loan_because: it's a very easy way to help someone in a constructive way

lender.name: john
lender.loan_because: I want to help in some small way

lender.name: Abbey
lender.loan_because: it reminds me how lucky I am. Also, kiva loans aren't just another band-aid solution; they are a real way for the hardworking people of these disadvantaged areas to improve the life of their family. It gives them incentive to teach their children to always keep reaching for a better life, because for some, these loans offer the first real indication of something out there to reach for.

lender.name: Beth
lender.loan_because: Because I Can
lender.occupational_info: I work in watercolours, warm glass, fine sliver and an eclectic collection of anything else. I love bold colours and incorporate them in everything I do.

lender.name: Kendall
lender.loan_because: We are each responsible to demonstrate the generosity of the people of the United States that is not always represented by our leaders.
lender.occupational_info: I am a librarian and technology specialist in a large elementary school in the Pacific Northwest.

lender.name: Craig
lender.loan_because: I hope my efforts here help make a positive impact no matter how small all over the world. And when one person repays I'm going to keep that money going to the next person it can help.

lender.name: Grace
lender.loan_because: it's a small way to make an impact

lender.name: Ashchin The Sharing Dog
lender.loan_because: I too am poor. I too needed other peoples money to start my small business. I have been shown great kindness and generosity sometimes from complete strangers. Time to pass the kindness on.
lender.occupational_info: I live in the bush and make a tasty syrup from the sap of some of the trees.

lender.name: Chad & Jennifer
lender.loan_because: we have the resources to share and we want to help others improve their lives.
lender.occupational_info: Jen teaches kindergarten students and Chad works with adults on environmental issues.

lender.name: MaryJean
lender.loan_because: I have been blessed with opportunity.
lender.occupational_info: I work with people having mental or emotional problems.

lender.name: Alan
lender.loan_because: Microcredit is cool! I love to see market forces help people help themselves.
lender.occupational_info: I make web sites to help people search for houses online.

lender.name: Laura
lender.loan_because: I want to help others build a better life for themselves and their families.

lender.name: darryl
lender.loan_because: I would like to start a Financial Consultant Biz. I am a homeless US Army Veteran at this time. I will start school this January.
lender.occupational_info: I would refer RE Developments to investors seeking to invest in viable projects. This can be done on the internet.

lender.name: Drake Family
lender.loan_because: it isn't our money, its Gods, we just steward it the best we can.
lender.occupational_info: John works at drawing and designing buildings, I help him sometimes, but mostly I just take care of our 2 boys

lender.name: Jens
lender.loan_because:
Everybody needs a chance to make the world better. I make loans because it is both the right and the smart thing to do.
The best part is that my loans are a direct, person-to-person connection with someone in need.
Kiva gives me everything I need to make a real, positive and personal difference for an entrepreneur, their family and their community by enabling me and you to make a loan of as little as $25.00 to the borrower of our choice.
Search for borrowers in need by location, gender, business sector and loan amount, see their pictures and read their stories.
Read detailed information on Kiva's field partners, the organizations on the ground in dozens of countries around world that make the loans happen.
Make your loans, and receive updates on the progress your borrowers make on the road to their dreams - helped along by your generosity and that of your fellow lenders.
Find out how satisfying helping others through Kiva can be - let's finance the next entrepreneur together.

lender.name: Olivia
lender.loan_because: Every little bit helps!
lender.occupational_info: I help students succeed in a university setting.

lender.name: Paul
lender.loan_because: I feel Kiva allows me to plug into the world community and offer a hand up for someone with the will to succeed.
lender.occupational_info: College Student

lender.name: Julie
lender.occupational_info: I help students get into college.

lender.name: Myra H.
lender.loan_because: This is the best way I know to leverage the money I can afford to loan to help other women succeed.

lender.name: Christine
lender.loan_because: I want to help others become financially self-sufficient in a way that builds confidence in themselves and hope in others.

lender.name: Bill
lender.loan_because: Responsibility encourages growth

lender.name: Mark
lender.occupation: Wandering Rambler Who Enjoys The Silence

lender.name: Sean
lender.loan_because: I have been very fortunate to have had people who believed in me enough to give me a chance and want to help others get the same. Particularly in Mexico, as that is my favorite place on earth!
lender.occupational_info: I oversee the garbage pick-up crews and drive a 25 tonne truck.

lender.name: Janna
lender.loan_because: Teach our children the value of money and of helping others.

lender.name: Jessica
lender.loan_because: I'm grateful that I'm able to.
lender.occupational_info: I design buildings. I love to travel, see new places, meet new people. I'm excited for the opportunity to lend a hand to someone working hard for what they want.

lender.name: Prof.H
lender.loan_because:
My work while in Cape Coast, Ghana, West Africa (at Mfantsipim School) changed my outlook on life. My sister gave an initial amount in my name and I found this site as a great way to give back to the country that I call my second home.
I also see Kiva as a way to give to other communities and people. I have interest in helping people in all of Africa, the Middle East and Asia as their success and prosperity is vital to our own.
lender.occupational_info: I teach literature, writing and the Bible to community college students. Community college in the U.S. is a great place for students who cannot either afford the tuition of larger institutions or do not have the academic skills to gain acceptance to such institutions. Basically my job is helping people understand and achieve.

lender.name: vuspell
lender.loan_because: of impulse.

lender.name: Davis
lender.occupational_info: I am studying engineering at the Colorado School of Mines.

lender.name: Pat
lender.loan_because: I believe a hand up is better than a handout.
lender.occupational_info: I manage Planning, Forecasting, and Sales and Operation Planning (S&OP) activities for a consumer produces company.

lender.name: Carol
lender.loan_because: I want to help where I can!
lender.occupational_info: I sell computers and software to Colleges and Universities.

lender.name: Tim
lender.loan_because: Helping out where I can.
lender.occupational_info: Working with computers.

lender.name: Deanna
lender.loan_because: I've been wanting to do this for a while. I believe in this.....

lender.name: John
lender.loan_because: I want to be able to help all of my fellow human beings anywhere I can
lender.occupational_info: I am thrilled to see that there is a way to help out others around the world like this and I am inspired by that in this all too frequently sad world that there is still kindness to be found. I was started by my uncle who gave me a gift certificate for Christmas 2007.

lender.name: four
lender.loan_because: I am trying to make the world a better place in the most effective ways I know how.
lender.occupational_info: I work with computers.

lender.name: Brian & Gay
lender.loan_because: We believe the way to make our world a better place is to believe in and be active participants in a different story, the story of the kingdom of God on earth.
lender.occupational_info: Brian helps create solutions that support Compassion International to help release children from poverty in Jesus' name. Gay teaches missionary children the cross-cultural skills they need to serve around the world.

lender.name: Joe & Jean-Ann & Scat
lender.loan_because: we got a small loan to start our business 30 years ago. now we can help someone else
lender.occupational_info: Joe Manages a 1890's store in a historic Park and Jean-Ann sews costumes for the Park Staff we are both semi-retired and work only in the summer months. Scat gives up one bag of treats a month for the cause.

lender.name: Debra
lender.loan_because: It is a way to give back and help make a positive impact in the world.
